page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Historical Buildings There are three main historical buildings in Alford. The{five sailed {mill}was built in the late eighteenth century by{Mr Sam Oxley.}It is 95ft tall and has 6 floors. It is capable of grinding between 4 and 5 tons a day. {St Wilfrids church}stands on the site of an earlier Norman church which was pulled down to make room for the present built by{Sir William of {Tothby.}There is a large south porch with a room above which was almost certainly the home of the Grammar school in the 16th century. The{Manor house}was built in 1540 by some unknown person. It was then restored by{John Scholey}and is now owned by Alford and District Civic Trust.
